chapters.description: Establish the core idea and vision for the game.

subItems.description: Develop the core idea of the game, including genre, theme, and unique selling points.
Research similar games and identify what makes your game unique.

chapters.description: Identify and understand your target audience to tailor the game effectively.

subItems.description: Create detailed profiles of your ideal players to guide design decisions.

chapters.description: Outline the fundamental gameplay mechanics and rules.

subItems.description: Define how players interact with the game and what actions they can take.
Ensure the game is fair and challenging, with well-balanced difficulty.

chapters.description: Create the narrative and characters that drive the game’s plot.

subItems.description: Outline the plot and progression of the game’s narrative.
Develop characters, including their backstories, motivations, and roles.

chapters.description: Design the visual and environmental aspects of the game.

subItems.description: Plan and create the game world, including maps, levels, and environments.
Define the visual style and artistic elements of the game.

chapters.description: Develop a prototype and conduct initial testing to refine the game.

subItems.description: Create a working model of the game to test core mechanics and features.
Conduct tests with real players to gather feedback and identify issues.

chapters.description: Prepare the game for release and execute the launch plan.

subItems.description: Make final adjustments and polish the game based on feedback.
Develop a marketing strategy and prepare for the game’s release to the public.
